Coffee consumption is a **input factor**. It means that it is one of the inputs from the user to the model.

#### Alternative names:
* Coffee
* Coffee consumption
* Caffeine

#### Uses

Coffee consumption is used by the model in the following places

* [Liver cancer](/model/LiverCancer)
* [Pancreas cancer](/model/PancreasCancer)
* [Uterus cancer](/model/UterusCancer)
* [Coronary heart disease](/model/Ischemic)
* [Parkinsons](/model/Parkinsons)

#### Guidance

The user input is a typed number and should answer the question

> How much coffee do you consume in a normal day?

The unit of the input is **Cups**, but can be changed to any of the units below

* Liters (1 Liters = 6.67 Cups)
* Ounces (1 Cups = 5.07 Ounces)

The answer has to be larger than 0 Cups. The answer is recommended to be larger than 0 Cups and smaller than 10 Cups. A standard cup is arond 150 ml (=5 ounces) of coffee made of 7 grams of coffee beans. Espressos are normally made with around 7 grams of coffee beans as well, so they should also be considered full cups.


### Optimizability

[Optimizability](/model/optimizabilities) is a subjective measure used to describe how easy it is to optimize a certain factor of your life. The optimizability of Coffee consumption is 5. This means that it can be interpreted as

> *It is possible to change, and it can be changed now or very soon.*
